alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 6:34PM MDT until May 12 at 5:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Upper Cheery Creek and Plum Creek, in Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 900 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas along and near the creeks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 632 PM MDT, gauge reports indicated earlier heavy rain due to thunderstorms producing increased flow in creeks. This is causing small stream flooding. Rapid river rises have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Rain will increase again overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Aurora, southwestern Centennial, Highlands Ranch, Castle Rock, Parker, eastern Littleton, Lone Tree, Roxborough Park, Larkspur, Franktown, Castle Pines, The Pinery, Sedalia, Greenland, Perry Park, Louviers, Ponderosa Park, Castlewood Canyon and Shamballa.
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
